AboutMe:
I'm an avid conlanger and linguistics enthusiast. I've self-taught the subject since early 2010, and was finally able to take a linguistics class when I started uni at FSU (apart from syntax, it was all review). I'm now at FGCU studying Mandarin Chinese and Spanish, and will be transferring to UGA next year to pursue an undergraduate degree in linguistics. I hope to one professor in Historical Linguistics.

My particular interests within this field include phonetics, historical linguistics, linguistic relativism, and many other things.

I have studied to some extent the following languages (in order of fluency): 

* English
* Spanish
* German
* French
* Mandarin Chinese
* Esperanto
* Latin

I can read and write in the following scripts (in order of literacy): 

 * Latin
 * My personal set of runes (I call them the "Milic Futhark"; I read them as well as Latin)
 * Elder Futhark
 * Anglo-Saxon Futhorc (first second alphabet, before 6th grade)
 * Greek
 * Cyrillic (I actually learned this before Greek, and it made Greek very easy :p )
 * Hebrew (I only know a few of the letters)
 * Simplified Chinese (learning it in school :) )

Plus a bunch of random orthographies using Latin :p .
